Sun of Faith - English: Chapter 27. Great Brahmā Makes a Request, and Buddha Travels to Varanasi.

Then the lord of the Saha world Brahma knew that the Buddha rested in repose. He thought, “The world will become unruly if the Buddha stays like this.” So he went before the Blessed One and made a request:
"The teachings that once appeared in Magadha
were not pure; realization was tainted.
Open the door to your nectar-like dharma!
Explain your realization without error!"
Inscription - English: The god Brahmā requests the Buddha to turn the wheel of dharma
Manual - English: Brahma offers a wheel and asks the Buddha to teach dharma. On his way to Varanasi the Buddha meets a non-Buddhist sage.

Sun of Faith - English: “Others will not understand what I have realized through great accumulations,” said the Buddha. So at first he did not agree.

Again Brahma requested, “Here in the world, there are people of great, intermediate, and inferior capacity. If those of great or intermediate capacity hear your teaching, they will understand it. If they don’t hear it, they will fall lower and lower. So certainly teach the dharma."

With wise vision the Buddha also knew this to be so. He replied, 
“I will open the door of the nectar-like [teaching]. 
Whoever wishes to hear it should not doubt. 
O Brahma, to humans, I’ll briefly explain the excellent dharma 
that gives no ground for dispute."
Brahma was pleased that the Buddha agreed, and he disappeared.
Seven weeks went by. While he was thinking of Udraka and Arada, the gods beseeched him to teach them.

The Buddha knew that seven days had passed since Udraka died and one day has passed since Arada died. “Alas, things went terribly wrong for them. If they had heard my teaching, they would have grasped its essence. I must teach it to others. Earlier, when I practiced austerities, the five ascetics who were my companions were devoted. So I shall teach to them.”
The Buddha arose from the foot of the Bodhi Tree, walked slowly over the land, and travelled to Kashi.
On the path he met Ajivika.
“Gotama, your eyes are bright. Your complexion is so clean. Your skin radiant. Who is your teacher?”

The Buddha said, 
“No one like me has come before;
I have no teacher. 
I alone in the world have awakened. 
I have attained perfect, supreme enlightenment.”
